Phase Boundary Tracing¶

class cemc.tools.PhaseBoundaryTracker(gs1, gs2, mu_name='c1_0', logfile='', chemical_potential=None, conf_same_phase=0.45, conf_substep_conv=0.05, max_singlet_change=0.05, backupfile='backup_phase_track.h5')[source]¶
backup(data, dsetname='data')[source]¶

Stores backup data to hdf5 file

Parameters:
  • data – Dictionary of data to be backed up
  • dsetname – Basename for all datasets in the h5 file

Check if the first arguments is larger than the second

Parameters:
  • x1 – First value
  • x2 – Second value
get_mean_field_phase_boundary(Tmin, Tmax, ntemps)[source]¶

Computes the phase boundary in the Mean Field Approximation

Parameters:
  • Tmin – Minimum temperature
  • Tmax – Maximum temperature
  • ntemps – Number of temperatures between Tmin and Tmax
get_zero_temperature_mu_boundary()[source]¶

Computes the chemical potential at which the two phases coexists at zero kelvin

is_equal(x1, x2, std1, std2, confidence_level=0.05, stdtol=1e-06, eps_fallback=0.05)[source]¶

Check if two numbers are equal provided that their standard deviations are known

Parameters:
  • x1 – First value
  • x2 – Second value
  • std1 – Standard deviation of the first value
  • std2 – Standard deviation of the second value
  • confidence_level – Confidence level for hypothesis testing
  • stdtol – If the standard deviation of the difference between x1 and x2 is smaller than this value. It will not perform hypothesis testing.
  • eps_fallback – If not hypothesis returns abs(x1-x1) < eps_fallback

Print message for logging

Construction of a common tangent point (NOT USED)

mean_field_separation_line(Tmax, nsteps=10)[source]¶

Computes the separation line in the mean field approximation

Parameters:
  • Tmax – Maximum temperature
  • nsteps – Number of steps between T=1K and Tmax
predict_composition(comp, temperatures, target_temp, target_comp=0.0)[source]¶

Performs a prediction of the next composition value based on history

Parameters:
  • comp – History of compositions
  • temperatures – History of temperatures
  • target_temp – Temperature where the composition should be predicted
  • target_comp – Not used

Resetting symbol and print a log message of the new elements

Parameters:
  • calc – CE calculator object
  • old_symbs – Symbols of old state

Solve the differential equation using adaptive euler

Parameters:
  • T0 – Initial temperature
  • min_step – Minimum step size in kelvin
  • stepsize – Initial stepsize in kelving
  • mc_args – Dictionary of arguments for the MC samplers. See cemc.mcmc.SGCMonteCarlo.runMC()
